name: Crinum
description: Crinum is a genus of more than 100 species of perennial plants in the family Amaryllidaceae, native to Africa, Southern Asia, Australia and warmer parts of the Americas.These plants can be found in moist environments in tropical and subtropical areas worldwide. They lend a tropical touch with their beautiful flowers throughout the year, but usually in the warmer months. The flowers are usually large and fragrant, ranging in shape from funnel-shaped to spider-like. They are borne in umbels atop leafless stalks and are either held horizontally or are pendulous. Crinums are easy to grow and are great for beds, borders and cutting gardens.
meaning: The genus name comes from the Greek “krinon”, meaning “white lily”, as most species have white or whitish flowers. The common name “Swamp Lily” comes from the fact that this plant is frequently found growing in swamps.
color_description: Most species have white or whitish flowers, but there are also pink, purple and red varieties. There are also a number of bi-colored varieties.
